inclusion.criterion: CAD diagnosis defined by the combination of - Chronic haemolysis
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Clinical symptoms requiring treatment, such as anaemia or Raynaud-like symptoms
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Year of first occurrence of clinical symptoms is registered along with data on haemolytic anaemia, circulatory symptoms, cold- or fever-induced exacerbation, previous therapies, lymph node enlargement, and spleen size (clinical assessment). Chest radiograph and abdominal ultrasonography should be done if not performed already during the last four months.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Haemolysis is detected and quantified based on Hb, reticulocyte count (x 10^9/L), LDH, bilirubin and haptoglobin. These measurements should be done twice during the last two months before treatment.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: The following haematological, biochemical and immunological assessments should be done once WBC, leukocyte differential count, platelet count
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Iron, transferrin (or TIBC), ferritin, cobalamine and folate
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Quantification of IgM, IgG and IgA
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Serum electrophoreses with immunofixation (*) (Immunofixation must be performed even if visual assessment of agarose electrophoreses does not show any monoclonal band.)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Specific direct antiglobulin test (DAT, direct Coombs' test), i.e. using polyspecific antiserum, anti-C3d and anti-IgG)
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Non-lymphatic malignant disease other than basal cell carcinoma
exclusion.label: unknown
